author: kaz
msg: Temporary property translator.  This is invoked on every Maven
invocation and basically looks for any of the old Maven properties that
might be currently defined, and then sets the corresponding "maven."
property to that value.
Why?  Well, with the property changes that were made to Maven, most of
our user base is still using the old stuff right now.  For example,
Torque's project.properties flie contains the property:
jarResources.basedir = src/templates
This means nothing to users of Maven HEAD.  As a result, the Torque jar
is build incorrectly for HEAD users.  If the property file is updated to
the new:
maven.jarResources.basedir = src/templates
That alienates our existing users.  So as a compromise (suggested by
james), we have property updater.  It updates transparently on the fly
for users.  When b4 is released, we can force users to update their
property files (or provide an updater for them).
